entry.title: Web Performnace Optimization
entry.content:
数据重载

  • cache: 缓数据避免同样数据重复获取
  • centralized management： 集中化数据管理，减少数据重复出现

数据过载

  • code spliting： 代码分块，是lazy loading的基础
  • lazy loading： 按需加载，而不提前加载
  • tree shaking： 减少无用代码，无用依赖

网络速率

  • cdn：自动选择最近节点，提高传输速率
  • gzip：压缩数据，提高传输速率
  • async：不卡顿其他数据传输，最大化传输能力
  • graphql：不传输无用的数据，节省传输时间

数据处理

  • data structure & algorithm：以性能优化的方式对数据进行存储和运算
  • memorize: 基于argument对function进行缓存，避免重复计算

Reference

entry.title: Descriptive Analysis
entry.content:
案例引入

你是某公司的数据分析师，有一天，你的上司给了你加州程序员收入的一张表格，需要你对加州程序员的收入情况进行汇报。请问你应该如何准备此次汇报？

  • 把原表甩给上司 -> 去吃鱿鱼
  • 计算描述性统计量，数值丢给上司 -> 去吃鱿鱼
  • 搞懂为什么要做描述性统计，计算描述性统计量，对数值结果进行解释 -> 还在公司有口饭吃

分析报告是基于数据整体情况给出的，所以需要用到统计分析

分析目标

  • 样本分布形态判别: 获取样本数据的整体分布形态，这决定了描述性分析之后数据模型的选择
  • 异常点检测：检测异常点，发现异常情况, 降低异常情况对后续分析过程的影响

分析角度

1. 集中趋势(Central Tendency)

集中趋势用来作为数据的集中代表，有三个值可以选择，对比分析时只选取最合适的一个

  • 均值(Mean):
    • 容易受到极端值的影响
    • 计算相对容易
    • 在正态分布或者近似正态分布情况下，采用均值代表数据的整体情况
  • 中位数(Median)：
    • 不容易受到极端值得影响
    • 在数据量很大的情况下，计算复杂
    • 在右偏分布下，采用中位数代表数据的整体情况
  • 众数(Mode)：
    • 不容易受到极端值的影响
    • 但是会受到数据脏点的影响
    • 在实际中，基本用不到

2. 离散程度(Dispersion)

  • 范围(Range)
    • 计算通过最大值和最小值得出
    • 包含的信息量很小，因此对于整体分析的价值不大
  • 方差
    • 衡量“均值”的代表性
    • 在需要求导的情况下使用
    • 可以解释为 数据的分化水平，是比较平均，还是差异比较大
  • 标准差
    • 方差开方即可
    • 有单位，因此经常使用
    • 可以解释为 数据的分化水平，是比较平均，还是差异比较大

3. 分布形态(Distribution Shape)

  • 峰度(Kurtosis)
    • 正态(=3): 基准
    • 尖峰厚尾(> 3)：数据出现在中心的概率增加，出现在近离群点的概率也增加
    • 低峰瘦尾(< 3)：数据出现在中心的概率减小，出现在近离群点的概率也减小
  • 偏度(Skewness)
    • 正态(0): 基准
    • 受到离群点的影响而形成
    • 偏度大于0.5意味着高偏度
    • 左偏(<0)：均值<中位数<众数 (左偏数据很少遇到)
    • 右偏(>0)：众数>中位数>均值

分析流程

  • Step 1: 看样本量即观测数的大小，是小样本数据还是大样本数据
  • Step 2: 看数据的偏度：数值为正则为右偏，数值为负则为左偏，数值为0则为正态偏度
  • Step 3: 看数据的集中趋势: 如果数据有偏，则选取中位数；无偏则选取均值作为数据的代表; 选取后根据均值、中位数的大小来验证对数据有偏和无偏的判断
  • Step 4: 看数据的离散趋势：在需要对比的情况下，能够得出数据基于均值的分化情况，是比较集中还是分化严重
  • Step 5: 可选地增加对众数、峰度的描述

相关知识

观测数

  • 样本量的大小
  • <30 意味着小样本

分布形态

  • 正态分布：多出现于自然界
  • 泊松分布：网页点击量, 排队长度
  • 伽玛分布：灾难损失
  • 对数正态分布：(取对数后为正态分布): 收入情况

标准误差与标准差

  • 标准差:一次抽样中个体分数间的离散程度，反映了个体分数对样本均值的代表性，用于描述统计
  • 标准误差：多次抽样中样本均值间的离散程度，反映了样本均值对总体均值的代表性，用于推论统计

参考资料

Interpret Descriptive Statistics

描述性统计与探索型数据分析（上）

描述性统计与探索型数据分析（下）

数据分析之描述性统计

CFA一级重难点：分布的偏度和峰度

Minitab 18 描述型统计

entry.title: Create React App From Scratch
entry.content:
ToolDescriptionBranch
GitVersion ControlRepo; Husky; Boilerplate
WebpackBundlerMode; Server; Debugger; Analyzer; Externalize
BabelTranspilerReact Class; Loader; Polyfill
ReactComponent WebHot Loading; Lazy Loading; Strict Mode; Error Boundary; propTypes
NPMNodeGit Repo Info; Scripts
TestTest codeJest & Enzyme
Code FormatterFormat codePrettier
Code Error DetectorDetect potential error of codeESLint; react-axe

Intialize Project

  • Create react-webpack folder
  • Initialize package.json
  • Initialize .git
  • Create react-from-scratch in Github
  • Append git info to package.json
  • Add .gitignore

Webpack

  • Install yarn add --dev webpack webpack-cli
  • Modify package.json
  • Webpack two modes：
    • production (default) -> minimized and optimize bundle.js yarn build
    • development mode -> more code but kind of readable if you want to debug (seldomly) yarn build -- --mode development
  • config webpack.config.js

Babel

- Install `yarn add --dev @babel/core @babel/cli @babel/preset-env`- Install `yarn add --dev babel-loader`- Config `webpack.config.js`

React

  • Install yarn add react react-dom prop-types
  • Babel Support yarn add @babel/preset-react
  • Config webpack.config.js
  • Install yarn add --dev html-webpack-plugin
    • It will generate the an entry html file in the dist folder.
    • The entry html file will automatically include the bundled js file.
    • For react app, we need an entry html to plugin all the components.
    • One html entry point and one javascript, That's all for a React App, right?
  • create boilerplate of entry html
  • Modify webpack.config.js
  • Webpack Watch Mode
    • watch mode: every time a file changes, the webpack will rebuild
    • very suitable for development mode
  • Modify package.json

Webpack Config Branching

  • Install yarn add --dev webpack-merge
  • Rename webpack.config.js to webpack.config.base.js
  • Create webpack.config.prod.js and webpack.config.dev.js
  • Config webpack.config.prod.js
  • Config webpack.config.dev.js
  • Modify package.json

Run React App in Local Server

  • Eveytime you modify files, webpack will rebuild and the brower will be automatically refreshed
  • Install yarn add --dev webpack-dev-server
  • Modify package.json
  • Modify webpack.config.dev.js

Debugger

  • Debugger is a break point
  • Add debugger in App.js
  • Modify webpack.config.dev.js
  • open browser -> inspect -> refesh App page -> check source code

Syntax Support for React Class

  • Install yarn add --dev @babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties
  • Modify webpack.config.base.js

Loader for CSS

  • Install yarn add --dev style-loader css-loader
  • Modify webpack.confg.base.js

React Hot Loading

  • Keep state when you modify code
  • Install yarn add react-hot-loader
  • Modify webpack.config.dev.js
  • Modify the component you want to use react-hot-loader
  • Modify package.json

Remove Duplicates in package.json

  • Before
  • After

Webpack Bundle Analyzer

  • Install yarn add --dev webpack-bundle-analyzer
  • Modify the webpack.config.prod.js
  • yarn build -> will generate a report in dist

Externalize in Webpack

  • React and ReactDOM CDN
  • Modify webpack.config.prod.js
  • Modify src/index.html (EJS)

Polyfill for Browsers

  • Polyfill: provide something that browser cannot do
  • Install yarn add @babel/polyfill
  • Modify index.js
  • Polyfill will make the bundle file large significantly, need selection to slim bunlde file.
    npx browserslist "last 2 versons, not dead, not < 2%" (market share)
  • Modify webpack.config.base.js

React Lazy Loading

  • Import on use -> this will improve performance.
  • Install yarn add @babel/plugin-syntax-dynamic-import
  • Modify webpack.config.base.js
  • Before
  • After

Jest Testing Library - Jest & Enzyme

  • Install yarn add --dev jest ts-jest jest-static-stubs identity-obj-proxy enzyme @types/enzyme enzyme-adapter-react-16 enzyme-to-json
  • Modify package.json
  • Config enzyme.setup.ts

Code Formatter: Prettier

  • Install yarn add --dev prettier pretty-quick
  • Modify package.json
  • Config .prettierrc
  • Config .prettierignore
  • Or you could use vs-code prettier (Easy)

Code Industry Normalization: ESLint

  • ESLint: hint potential error of code before actually running it.
  • Install yarn add --dev eslint eslint-plugin-react@latest
  • Modify package.json
  • Initialize ESLint ./node_modules/.bin/eslint --init
  • Config .eslintignore
  • Install yarn add --dev babel-eslint
  • Modify .eslintrc.json
  • Then yarn lint will tell you some common errors -> trace the errors and fix them.

Detect Accessibility Issues with ESLint

  • Accessibility: for example, if you don’t set alt key for <img>, it’s not accessible
  • Install yarn add --dev eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y
  • Modify .eslintrc.json

Detect Accessibility Issues that ESLint can't detect

  • Install yarn add --dev react-axe
  • The detector will be shown in chrome console
  • Modify index.js

Husky: make commit good

  • Install yarn add --dev husky
  • Modify package.json
  • When you run git commit ...
    • it will format the staged file
    • it will lint files
    • it will test files
      • if it fails, commit never happens
      • if it succeeds, commit succeeds.

React Strict Mode

  • Only useful in development mode rather than in production mode
  • You want to check method version (deprecated) problems deep in the code tree -> use <React.StrictMode/>

Error Boundary

  • Case: Error not handled.
  • Normally, nothing will be shown.
  • But you want to show sth when there is a error
  • Create src/DefaultErrorBoundary
  • Modify index.js

Define propTypes for React

  • lint: 'children' is missing in props validation
  • solution: define propTypes
  • Install yarn add prop-types
  • Modify DefaultsErrorBoundary.js

Boilerplate to create React app

  • Step 1: slim your configured React App to a boilerplate
  • Step 2: git add && commit && push to the remote repo
  • Step 3: git clone --depth=1 git@... project_name to clone the last commit of the remote repo
  • Step 4: cd the project and rm -rf .git
  • Step 5: intialize as your own project git init
  • Step 6: go back to the start of this tutorial, you will know what to do next.

Questions

What is preset-env

  • preset-env includes a lot of latest javascript version, for example, es2015; es2016; es2107
  • preset-react is especially for react code

How to run webpack manually?

node_modules/.bin/webpack

  • loader is sth that helps webpack to translate some kind of files.

entry.title: Redux Thunk
entry.content:
Question

  1. How to make asynchronous call in Redux React App?
    • the asynchronous request should be called within the action creator in the componentDidMount()
  2. I did call the asynchronous request call in action creator, but there two bugs: a. action should be plain objects b. use middleware. What’s the reason?
    • a. async will let the action creator return sth not a plain object. Debug to use babeljs.io
    • b. using promise will also not solve the problem because you have not got the data before dispatching it to store.

Bad Practice

  1. What’s the right way to do the asynchorous call?
    • use Middleware like Redux Thunk

Middleware Way

  • Middleware allows your action creator to return a function or an action
  • If you return a function by an action creator, the middleware will automatically call the function
  • If you return an action, it acts like the middleware doesn’t do anything.
  • Thunk is used to do asynchronous call before the action is arrived at store.

What is middleware?

  • Middleware is added between reducers and dispatch()
  • could STOP, MODIFY actions
  • Redux-thunk is a middleware to deal with async issues of React.

Memoization

  • is a way to cache function
  • There are many ways to cache.
NameTimeWhere
Function cacheat the same timeLocal
HTTP cacheat different timeServer

Entrance

Wrong!

  • same id, same function, rather than the action itself!
  • so same request will still be called multiple times.

Wrong Again!

  • everytime we call fetchUser, we create a new function.

Right!!!

The simpler way even doesn’t work …

Conclusion @_@

  • always make _.memoize() inside a wrapper function like _fetchUser() if you want to pass parameters into it.

When do you need to use await?

  • The current request depends on the response of last request.

entry.content:
Key Points

NameWhatWhereAnalogyExample
ActionPayloads send from view to store.ViewHTTP Post Body{ type: 'SONG_SELECTED', payload: "Hello world" }
Action CreatorFunction to generate actionsViewWrapper / Decorator(song) => {type:'SONG_SELECTED', payload: song}
dispatch()Function that sends actions to storeViewgmail()dispatch(action)
StateData needs to be centralizedStoreStatic Variable in Java
ReducerFunction to update state according to actionStoreSetter method in Java(selectSong = null, action) => {if (action.type === 'SONG_SELECTED') return action.payload;} return selectedSong
StoreThe place to store state and reducerGlobalBankcreateStore(combinedReducers)
MiddlewareFunction that get called with every action we dispatchBetween Reducer and dispatch()Gas StationRedux Thunk

Architecture

Essence

When to use Redux

  • Different users have different ways to use.
  • Colloboration between users.
  • Intense commnunication wtih servers or with websocket.
  • View need to get data from multiple sources.

Summaruy: the same state is going to be used by many different views, then it’s better to put it into redux.

Main Structure

  1. "What happened in the view?"
  2. "How to send actions to store?"
  3. "How to update the store in response to actions?"
  • Actions: payloads send from view to store.
  • dispatch(): function to send action from view to store
  • Reducers: specify how state changes in response to actions sent to the store. Reducer review current state and action as parameters.
  • Store: hold state; return state getState(); update state dispatch(action), register listener subscribe(listener)

Question

  • How the redux match between reducer and action?
    • It happens internal within the store.
    • All the reducers will check the action type (Iteration)
  • Can we deal with same type of actions in different reducers?
    • Sure!
    • All these reducers will be triggerred when the action come.
  • Why we need use action creator?
    • The reason is like whey you use decorator or wrapper function.
    • Reason one: trigger in the future.
    • Reason two: pass external parameters
  • Why we call it reducer?
    • Usage of state and the state itself is similar to many-to-one relationship.
    • Reducer is used to reduce manipulation to update state.
  • What is difference bewtween ownProps and ReduxProps?
    • ownProps is props passed from parent components.
    • ReduxProps is props passed from redux.
    • ownProps is used to pass normal props to mapStateToProps function

Important

Reducers

  • The key of reducers in the combinedReducers is actually the name of one state.
  • The key of reducers must be the same with the return name in the specifc reducer.

Action creators

  • Case: when you pass { actionCreator } to connect()
  • you need call it actionCreator by this.props.actionCreator() rather than actionCreator()
  • Reason: because you doesn’t dispatch the action creator in actionCreator() way. But the this.props.actionCreator is will be automatically dispatched by connect function

entry.title: Margin Collapsing
entry.content:
Margin Collapsing

It happens by default to resolve the collapsing of two adjecent margin by eliminating the shorter one.

1. Adjacent Siblings
In this case, the first element might have a margin of 10px (on all sides let’s say) and the second one has 5px (or 20px - the values don’t matter).CSS will collapse the margins and only add the bigger one between the elements. So if we got margins of 10px and 5px , a 10px margin would be added between the elements?

2. A parent with children that have a margin
To be precise, the first and/ or last or the only child has to have margins (top and/ or bottom). In that case, the parent elements margin will collapse with the child element(s)’ margins. Again, the bigger margin wins and will be applied to the parent element.If the parent element has padding, inline content (other than the child elements) or a border, this behavior should not occur, the child margin will instead be added to the content of the wrapping parent element.

3. An empty element with margins
This case probably doesn’t occur that often but if you got an element with no content, no padding, no border and no height, then the top and bottom margin will be merged into one single margin. Again, the bigger one wins.
